Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.11.3 to 1.12.2.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.12.2 (2025-10-13)

This release fixes a cargo doc breakage on nightly when --cfg docsrs is enabled. This caused documentation to fail to build on docs.rs.

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1305](rust-lang/regex#1305): Switches the doc_auto_cfg feature to doc_cfg on nightly for docs.rs builds.

1.12.1 (2025-10-10)

This release makes a bug fix in the new regex::Captures::get_match API introduced in 1.12.0. There was an oversight with the lifetime parameter for the Match returned. This is technically a breaking change, but given that it was caught almost immediately and I've yanked the 1.12.0 release, I think this is fine.

1.12.0 (2025-10-10)

This release contains a smattering of bug fixes, a fix for excessive memory consumption in some cases and a new regex::Captures::get_match API.

Improvements:

  • [FEATURE #1146](rust-lang/regex#1146): Add Capture::get_match for returning the overall match without unwrap().

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1083](rust-lang/regex#1083): Fixes a panic in the lazy DFA (can only occur for especially large regexes).
  • [BUG #1116](rust-lang/regex#1116): Fixes a memory usage regression for large regexes (introduced in regex 1.9).
  • [BUG #1195](rust-lang/regex#1195): Fix universal start states in sparse DFA.
  • [BUG #1295](rust-lang/regex#1295): Fixes a panic when deserializing a corrupted dense DFA.
  • BUG 8f5d9479: Make regex_automata::meta::Regex::find consistently return None when WhichCaptures::None is used.

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump serde_yaml_bw from 2.0.1 to 2.4.1

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [serde_yaml_bw](https://github.com/bourumir-wyngs/serde-yaml-bw) from 2.0.1 to 2.4.1.
Release notes

Sourced from serde_yaml_bw's releases.

2.4.0 Saphyr shield

After we intensified fuzz testing, we found that specific long sequences can cause the underlying libyaml library (regardless of which variety of it) to stall. While it neither crashes nor enables exploits, it may consume excessive time and memory to process such input, opening the door to denial-of-service attacks.

To counter this, we apply a fast sanity pre-check. This mechanism is fully configurable via a Budget, available as part of DeserializerOptions.

The budget check uses a separate saphyr-parser, which operates without constructing a syntax tree and terminates immediately once any resource limit is exceeded. We plan to migrate the main parser to it later anyway.

2.3.0 unsafe_libyaml switch: Norway!

This is a security release, the library is switched into maintained unsafe-libyaml-norway rather than unsafe_libyaml. In version 0.0.4, libyml::string::yaml_string_extend was revised, resulting in undefined behaviour, which is unsound (see advisory GHSA-gfxp-f68g-8x78) so we switched to another library. It is a drop-in replacement, and our extensive test suite confirms that it can seamlessly take over without any issues.

2.1.3 Struct as schema

This release adds usage of the passed Rust struct as a YAML schema. Knowing that our parsing target is a String or a boolean field allows us to parse correctly values that would result in an error if parsed without this background knowledge:

  • YAML sees values like 1.2 as numbers, but if it is something like a version, the parsing target is likely to be a string. If parsed into a structure field, it is easy to see if the parsing target is a string or a number; hence, 1.2 can also be parsed as "1.2" without generating an unnecessary error.
  • Values like y, on, n, no, off can be used as boolean values in YAML 1.1. This causes the "Norway problem" if the parsing target is actually a string. However, if we know the parsing target, it is easy to parse "no" as false (for boolean) or as a String (for String).
  • We also wrote tests and verified that JSON parsing also works; even if it was not necessary to add anything, it just did.
  • There are also many small changes and improvements in the code, as well as multiple new tests and further guarantees that the library will not panic.

2.1.1 Streaming

This iteration adds support for streaming, as well as additional control over serialization and deserialization.

Already in the previous version, the reader did not load the entire content into memory before parsing. With the current extensions, it is now possible to read multiple documents from a stream, potentially as they arrive.

Recursion limits are now configurable, allowing stricter settings tailored to the specific use case. Finally, there is now some control over the output format, such as indentation and desired line length.

2.1.0 Nested enums, !!binary and more hardening

This release adds support for nested enums and the !!binary tag. It also introduces additional safety improvements, such as avoiding loading potentially large and meaningless content entirely into memory before parsing begins, enforcing limits on name length, adding measures and tests against infinite recursion, and preventing possible keystroke injection through error messages. Furthermore, the number of constructs capable of causing panics has been reduced, and test coverage has been increased.

Enums are now serialized and deserialized as externally tagged by default. This change enables support for nested enums, aligning well with Rust's ability to associate polymorphic data with enums. While the old tag-based format will still be recognized and correctly deserialized, we generally discourage its use because it poses difficulties in representing nested enums as valid YAML — at least with our current parser library.

2.0.2 Merge keys and safety hardening

This release adds merge keys, a feature of YAML 1.2. It also now supports the three dots (...) as the end marker.

It also contains a number of safety hardening improvements:

  • Eliminated uses of unsafe mem::transmute in the serializer by restructuring the API to use lifetimes instead.
  • Replace some unsafe pointer conversions with safe str::from_utf8 checks.
  • Prevent jump-count overflow during deserialization.
  • Cycle detection when merging YAML aliases to prevent infinite recursion.
  • Restrict the CStr wrapper so it implements Send and Sync only for 'static references, guarding against dangling pointers across threads.

candidates.body:
Bumps [spdx](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/spdx) from 0.10.8 to 0.12.0.
Release notes

Sourced from spdx's releases.

0.12.0

Added

  • PR#81 resolved #68 by adding support for the WITH [%s"DocumentRef-"(idstring)":"]%s"AdditionRef-"(idstring) syntax. Thanks @​weihanglo!

0.11.1

Changed

  • PR#80 changed how Licensee::satisfies works for GNU licenses again, it now requires that the license ids match exactly. This is incredibly pedantic but means it's up to consumers if the want to have a smarter comparison, I just don't want to have to care about GNU licenses, ever.

Fixed

  • PR#80 reverted a change introduced in PR#78 that would auto-fixup GNU licenses to their non-deprecated forms eg. GPL-2.0 => GPL-2.0-only. This is no longer done, resolving #79.

0.11.0

Changed

  • PR#78 removed ParseMode::allow_lower_case_operators, newer revisions of the SPDX spec allow all lower-case operators, making the option pointless.
  • PR#78 added ParseMode::allow_deprecated, which will cause an error if a deprecated license identifier is used, false in LAX and true in STRICT.
  • PR#78 changed the various imprecise names for GPL licenses to be mapped to the non-deprecated -only versions.
  • PR#78 Expression::canonicalize now always changes GNU licenses to be -only or -or-later as the bare identifiers are deprecated.

Added

  • PR#78 added LicenseId::version to retrieve the numeric version of the license if it has one.
  • PR#78 added LicenseId::base to retrieve the base name of the license.
  • PR#78 added gnu_license_id which attempts to retrieve the license id for a GNU license from its base identifier. This retrieves the -only or -or-later license that matches.
  • PR#78 added Licensee::parse_mode, Licensee::parse now forwards to that function with ParseMode::STRICT.
  • PR#78 added Reason::GnuPlusWithSuffix and Reason::DeprecatedLicenseId as errors.

Fixed

  • PR#78 fixed an issue where Licensee::satisfies would not properly allow some licenses if the version was not at the end when using a +, notably the BSD licenses have the version in the middle of the license id.
  • PR#78 fixed the handling of GNU licenses in Licensee::satisfies, at least to my best understanding.
    Licensee GPL-1.0-only GPL-1.0-or-later GPL-2.0-only GPL-2.0-or-later GPL-3.0-only GPL-3.0-or-later
    GPL-1.0-only ✅ ✅ ❌ ❌ ❌ ❌
    GPL-1.0-or-later ✅ ✅ ❌ ❌ ❌ ❌
    GPL-2.0-only ❌ ✅ ✅ ✅ ❌ ❌
    GPL-2.0-or-later ❌ ✅ ✅ ✅ ❌ ❌
    GPL-3.0-only ❌ ✅ ❌ ✅ ✅ ✅
    GPL-3.0-or-later ❌ ✅ ❌ ✅ ✅ ✅

0.10.9

Changed

  • PR#74 update SPDX license list to 3.27.0.

chosen_pr.title: chore(deps): bump regex from 1.11.3 to 1.12.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.11.3 to 1.12.2.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.12.2 (2025-10-13)

This release fixes a cargo doc breakage on nightly when --cfg docsrs is enabled. This caused documentation to fail to build on docs.rs.

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1305](rust-lang/regex#1305): Switches the doc_auto_cfg feature to doc_cfg on nightly for docs.rs builds.

1.12.1 (2025-10-10)

This release makes a bug fix in the new regex::Captures::get_match API introduced in 1.12.0. There was an oversight with the lifetime parameter for the Match returned. This is technically a breaking change, but given that it was caught almost immediately and I've yanked the 1.12.0 release, I think this is fine.

1.12.0 (2025-10-10)

This release contains a smattering of bug fixes, a fix for excessive memory consumption in some cases and a new regex::Captures::get_match API.

Improvements:

  • [FEATURE #1146](rust-lang/regex#1146): Add Capture::get_match for returning the overall match without unwrap().

Bug fixes:

  • [BUG #1083](rust-lang/regex#1083): Fixes a panic in the lazy DFA (can only occur for especially large regexes).
  • [BUG #1116](rust-lang/regex#1116): Fixes a memory usage regression for large regexes (introduced in regex 1.9).
  • [BUG #1195](rust-lang/regex#1195): Fix universal start states in sparse DFA.
  • [BUG #1295](rust-lang/regex#1295): Fixes a panic when deserializing a corrupted dense DFA.
  • BUG 8f5d9479: Make regex_automata::meta::Regex::find consistently return None when WhichCaptures::None is used.
Commits

  • 0089034 regex-cli-0.2.3
  • 140f894 regex-lite-0.1.8
  • 27d6d65 1.12.1
  • 85398ad changelog: 1.12.1
